Node.definition: = state in which a countable entity is three in number
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) who allowed the exiles from Judah (יְהוּדָה) to return
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of Cyrus (כֹּורֶשׁ) I.
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
= man, also known as Belteshazzar; ► main character of the book of Daniel; possibly to be identified with one of three righteous men mentioned in Ezekiel
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= man; ► the Babylonian name given to Daniel (דָּנִיֵּאל)
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state of serving as a soldier in active combat
= state in which an event has a high intensity

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man, also known as Belteshazzar; ► main character of the book of Daniel; possibly to be identified with one of three righteous men mentioned in Ezekiel
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= the cycle of seven days from the first day to the seventh, which is the sabbath (שַׁבָּת)
= state in which a certain time span has fully elapsed
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to anoint oneself (with oil)|to rub (oil) on oneself|to groom oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans pour or rub liquid, usually olive oil, on their body ► to clean and smooth the skin as an act of grooming

Node.gloss: to anoint oneself (with oil)|to rub (oil) on oneself|to groom oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans pour or rub liquid, usually olive oil, on their body ► to clean and smooth the skin as an act of grooming
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which a certain amount of time fully elapses
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= the cycle of seven days from the first day to the seventh, which is the sabbath (שַׁבָּת)
= state in which a certain time span has fully elapsed

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: hand; hence: = pertaining to the location to the left or right of an object ◄ analogous to the location of someone's hands or arms
= large body of flowing water; ◄ in Mesopotamia ≈ flowing from the Garden of Eden (עֵדֶן)
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= river, usually identified with the Tigris; ◄ running through Mesopotamia; ► one of the four rivers flowing from the garden of Eden (עֵדֶן)
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
literally: to gird (one's) loins; hence: = action by which humans hitch up their mantle and keep it in place with a belt around their waist, ► in order to be able to walk or work

Node.gloss: to be girded with|to wear (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor
= poetic term for gold (זָהָב)
= region; ► known for its gold
= the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or animal, either alive or dead
= (semi )precious stone, possibly kind of beryl, which is colorless in its pure form
= the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
literally: the eye (of an object); hence: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= state in which an object reflects light ◄ as a result of having been polished
= a large group of people

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man, also known as Belteshazzar; ► main character of the book of Daniel; possibly to be identified with one of three righteous men mentioned in Ezekiel
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
marker that introduces a different line of thought, which does not necessarily contradict what was said before
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= state in which an event has a high intensity
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen by others; ► in order to be safe from danger or to attack someone else
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= process by which events take on a different nature
= state in which humans have the strength or power they need to function well
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to lie in a deep sleep
Node.definition: = state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
= slightly curved area of the human body or another object

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call

= state in which humans are being highly regarded

literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish

literally: to bow down; hence: = action by which humans put themselves in a lowered status or position with respect to other humans or deities
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of Cyrus (כֹּורֶשׁ) I.

= heavenly creature; ► prince of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state of authority within a group of people
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans, animals, or objects remain in a certain place after part of the original quantity has been located elsewhere
relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of Cyrus (כֹּורֶשׁ) I.

Node.gloss: to instruct|to give instruction|to teach|to give understanding|to explain
Node.definition: = pattern of actions by which someone helps others to gain knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion

= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to be dumb|to be unable to speak
Node.definition: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= state in which objects are, or are perceived as having something in common with other objects
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= process by which difficult circumstances start to affect humans
= state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling
= state in which humans have the strength or power they need to function well
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
= the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a written document, written on an unspecified surface
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
